intro: Gyrostipula comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian ironwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and montane rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
